gui

Interface GuiConnect

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Map

    public interface GuiConnect
    Creates connection between GUI and Game classes

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fight()
      Player wants to fight the monster.
      java.lang.String getHelp()
      Get help and instructions to play the game.
      java.lang.String getItemName()
      Tells the GUI name of the item in the current room.

      Returns the description of the current room.

      Returns the file name of the image for the current room.

      • getStats

        java.lang.String[] getStats()
        Get player stats as array of String. The array has the following structure: 0: name of player 1: his current KP 2: his current level 3: name of the equipped weapon 4: collected amount of gold 5: number of gone steps
        Returns:
        String array of fixed length with 6 entries.

      • getHelp

        java.lang.String getHelp()
        Get help and instructions to play the game.
        Returns:

      • showAndWait

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> showAndWait()
        Returns the messages the GUI needs to display about what creatures and items are in the room.
        Returns:
        A list of Strings which will be displayed

      • setPlayerName

        void setPlayerName(java.lang.String name)
        Set player name
        Parameters:
        name - the new name of the player

      • getItemName

        java.lang.String getItemName()
        Tells the GUI name of the item in the current room. Item can be a weapon or a treasure.
        Returns:
        Name of the item stored in the current room.

      • takeItem

        void takeItem()
        Tells the map to take the item into the inventory of the player.

      • isGameWon

        boolean isGameWon()
        Tells the gui if the player finished the game.
        Returns:
        whether game is won

      • isGameLost

        boolean isGameLost()
        Tells the gui if the player died.
        Returns:
        whether game is lost
